Edison Pebojot Blog Project Podcast Research Photograph & Video About
Edison Pebojot
Edison Pebojot

Hello, my name is Edison. I’m an engineer and a doctoral candidate, on the verge of earning my PhD. I have a passion for outdoor adventures and various other activities. Capturing life’s moments through photography is something I enjoy, and I take pleasure in sharing my experiences from the industry, life, and the knowledge I’ve gained.

Born: Dingalan, Aurora, Philippines

Education: AMA Computer University (MIT - Master in Information Technology)

  • The Future of Web Design Powered by AI
  • Bikepacking/Trek/Trail
  • Software/Engineering
  • Rock/Sports/Climbing
  • Data Architecture for System Map Control
  • Camping/Backpacking/Hiking
  • Using Distributed algorithms to System architecture
  • Is it possible to use an algorithm in a system (or humans)?
  • Design for the benefit of the community
  • Modern approach and practice for CI and CD
  • Software Defects Management for Mistake
  • Continual Improvement for Kanban Team
  • The Software Industry's Project Management. Basically
  • Describe Your Task as a Software Developer
  • The Basics of Software Requirement Gathering
  • Muon: Software Package Directory
  • Software Ethics to me (or to you)
  • An Android Platform for Filipino Employment (Beta Program)
  • www.pebojot.com
  • The Vacuum Project
  • Elliptic Curve Cryptography and Quantum Computing: The Mathematics
  • Braindotnet
  • Hackathon Event: AMA Computer University
  • Tree Planting: About Environmental Conservation
  • Theater: Acting Session for El Filibusterismo in Grade 10

Front-End, Back-End, Full Stack, Architecture

The Future of Web Design Powered by AI

Embark on the journey of crafting a user-centric website with a holistic approach to web design. From foundational elements like sitemaps and wireframes to the nuances of psychological insights, this exploration covers essential principles and methodologies.

Embark on the journey of crafting a user-centric website with a holistic approach to web design.

Latest Photograph & Video

Adventure, Outdoor, Activity, Fun, Trek

Moments and Future Hike Invitations

This video was created in late 2022. I typically don't feel at ease sharing my videos with everyone unless I'm acquainted with you, I suppose. Nonetheless, I kept the video brief—a compilation of snippets, not featuring every recording but showcasing the highlights of our activities from the past year. Eagerly looking forward to embarking on new hikes. If you're interested in joining, feel free to come along.

This video was created in late 2022. I typically don't feel at ease sharing my videos with everyone unless I'm acquainted with you, I suppose. Nonetheless, I kept the video brief—a compilation of snippets, not featuring every recording but showcasing the highlights of our activities from the past year. Eagerly looking forward to embarking on new hikes. If you're interested in joining, feel free to come along.

01 May 2022

See More

Rainy Ascent & Chilly Peaks

We reached the summit of Mt. Suso—I'm not entirely sure if I spelled it right. It was raining during our ascent, making it quite chilly at the peak. Luckily, our tour guide assisted us by providing hot soup once we descended.

We reached the summit of Mt. Suso—I'm not entirely sure if I spelled it right. It was raining during our ascent, making it quite chilly at the peak. Luckily, our tour guide assisted us by providing hot soup once we descended. Following that, we engaged in a variety of activities, including climbing stones at the summit.

01 Aug 2023

See More

A Repeat Retreat to the Tranquil Camping Haven

Recently arrived at a camping site. I'm eager to revisit this spot repeatedly; the experience of ascending here was genuinely rejuvenating. The air is incredibly fresh, and individuals engage in meaningful conversations, truly immersing themselves in the present moment. Away from the clamor of the world, surrounded by nature, finding peace of mind. It's simply reconnecting with the natural world once more.

Recently arrived at a camping site. I'm eager to revisit this spot repeatedly; the experience of ascending here was genuinely rejuvenating. Latest Podcast

Engineering, Architecture, Science

Episode 3: The Software Industry's Project Management.

Scrum is based on the cargo cult belief system. It involves a software developer repeating the same process every day without realising it. This leads to imposter syndrome, in which they lose sight of what's going on and get stuck in the rut.

Scrum is based on the cargo cult belief system. It involves a software developer repeating the same process every day without realising it.

01 Jan 2023

See More

Latest Project

Linux, Android, Progressive Web App, Package

Muon: Software Package Directory

The muon is a software package directory tool. It helps you to find software packages from different platform and programming languages. A software package is a software that has been built from source with one of the available package management systems. The package gives the compiled code.

The muon is a software package directory tool. It helps you to find software packages from different

A Repeat Retreat to the Tranquil Camping Haven

Recently arrived at a camping site. I'm eager to revisit this spot repeatedly; the experience of ascending here was genuinely rejuvenating. The air is incredibly fresh, and individuals engage in meaningful conversations, truly immersing themselves in the present moment. Away from the clamor of the world, surrounded by nature, finding peace of mind. It's simply reconnecting with the natural world once more.

Recently arrived at a camping site. I'm eager to revisit this spot repeatedly; the experience of ascending here was genuinely rejuvenating. The air is incredibly fresh, and individuals engage in meaningful conversations, truly immersing themselves in the present moment. Away from the clamor of the world, surrounded by nature, finding peace of mind. It's simply reconnecting with the natural world once more.

Away from the clamor of the world, surrounded by nature, finding peace of mind. It's simply reconnecting with the natural world once more.

Hello, my name is Edison. I’m an engineer and a doctoral candidate, on the verge of earning my PhD. I have a passion for outdoor adventures and various other activities. Capturing life’s moments through photography is something I enjoy, and I take pleasure in sharing my experiences from the industry, life, and the knowledge I’ve gained.

Born: Dingalan, Aurora, Philippines

Education: AMA Computer University (MIT - Master in Information Technology)

Moments and Future Hike Invitations

This video was created in late 2022. I typically don't feel at ease sharing my videos with everyone unless I'm acquainted with you, I suppose. Nonetheless, I kept the video brief—a compilation of snippets, not featuring every recording but showcasing the highlights of our activities from the past year. Eagerly looking forward to embarking on new hikes. If you're interested in joining, feel free to come along.

Rainy Ascent & Chilly Peaks

We reached the summit of Mt. Suso—I'm not entirely sure if I spelled it right. It was raining during our ascent, making it quite chilly at the peak. Luckily, our tour guide assisted us by providing hot soup once we descended.

We reached the summit of Mt. Suso—I'm not entirely sure if I spelled it right. It was raining during our ascent, making it quite chilly at the peak. Luckily, our tour guide assisted us by providing hot soup once we descended. Following that, we engaged in a variety of activities, including climbing stones at the summit.

A Repeat Retreat to the Tranquil Camping Haven

Recently arrived at a camping site. I'm eager to revisit this spot repeatedly; the experience of ascending here was genuinely rejuvenating. The air is incredibly fresh, and individuals engage in meaningful conversations, truly immersing themselves in the present moment. Away from the clamor of the world, surrounded by nature, finding peace of mind. It's simply reconnecting with the natural world once more.

Latest Podcast

Engineering, Architecture, Science

Episode 3: The Software Industry's Project Management.

Scrum is based on the cargo cult belief system. It involves a software developer repeating the same process every day without realising it. This leads to imposter syndrome, in which they lose sight of what's going on and get stuck in the rut.

Scrum is based on the cargo cult belief system. It involves a software developer repeating the same process every day without realising it.

Latest Project

Linux, Android, Progressive Web App, Package

Muon: Software Package Directory

The muon is a software package directory tool. It helps you to find software packages from different platform and programming languages. A software package is a software that has been built from source with one of the available package management systems. The package gives the compiled code.

The muon is a software package directory tool. It helps you to find software packages from different
